title: Language Structuring Learning Through Application of Transitive Reasoning and Inverse Concepts (Self-Directed)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical operations and understanding of linguistic structures
context.additional_context: Designed to systematically analyze complex language rules by applying mathematical thinking frameworks to language learning processes, emphasizing reasoning skills that learners in managerial/leadership roles can directly apply to designing organizational communication systems

learning_goals: Learners can map logical relationships between sentences using the inverse element concept in given linguistic structures.
Learners can construct semantic networks connecting meanings across multiple sentences by applying transitive reasoning.
Learners can analyze the structural consistency of linguistic rules using the inverse-operation-identity element system.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
